title._content: [Portrait of Jack Lesberg, Max Kaminsky, and Peanuts Hucko, Eddie Condon's, New York, N.Y., ca. May 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Jack Lesberg, Max Kaminsky, and Peanuts Hucko, Eddie Condon's, New York, N.Y., ca. May 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Here's three men on a bass--fiddle, that is. They are Jack Lesberg, who owns the instrument; Max Kaminsky, who merely has a trumpet to tote around, and Peanuts Hucko, who gets off even lighter than that, with a clarinet. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 202 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Three on bass," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 10 (May 7, 1947), p. 2. Subjects: Lesberg, Jack Kaminsky, Max, 1908- Hucko, Peanuts Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Double bassists--1940-1950. Trumpet players--1940-1950. Clarinetists--1940-1950. Saxophonists--1940-1950. Eddie Condon's Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.05581 Call Number: LC-GLB13- 0558
